abstract: Alaska prepares to ship tons of debris, most of which washed ashore as result of 2011 tsunami in Japan, by barge to Washington and Oregon for recycling; cleanup project is estimated to cost $1.3 million.
lead_paragraph: Tons of marine debris, some of it from the 2011 tsunami in Japan, will be airlifted from rocky beaches and taken by barge for disposal in the Pacific Northwest.

headline.main: Alaska Starts Cleaning Up Debris From Japan Spread by 2011 Tsunami
headline.print_headline: Alaska Starts Cleaning Up Debris Spread by Tsunami

snippet: Tons of marine debris, some of it from the 2011 tsunami in Japan, will be airlifted from rocky beaches and taken by barge for disposal in the Pacific Northwest.
